intro: Meibomia adhaesiva, commonly known as the sticky meibomia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. Meibomia adhaesiva is often found in moist, shaded environments within forests.
